===Etymology===
{{borrowing|ja|en|sort=くらぶ|club}}, in reference to an association or group of people.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

The spelling is [[ateji]], apparently from the early {{w|Meiji period}}, chosen for the senses of {{m|ja|倶|tr=ku|pos=[[音読み#Japanese|on'yomi]]; also a [[訓読み#Japanese|kun'yomi]] of ''tomo'' as in “{{l|en|together}}”}} + {{m|ja|楽|tr=ra|pos=irregular [[音読み#Japanese|on'yomi]], usually ''raku''; also a [[訓読み#Japanese|kun'yomi]] of ''tanoshimu'' as in “{{l|en|enjoy|to enjoy}}”}} + {{m|ja|部|tr=bu||part; division; section; department|pos=imparting a sense of “smaller [[group]] of [[people]]”}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|y=irr|クラブ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|クラブ}}

# a [[club]] {{gloss|as an association or group of people}}

====Usage notes====
More commonly spelled in [[katakana]], as {{m|ja|クラブ}}.

====Descendants====
* Chinese: {{zh-l|俱樂部}}
* Vietnamese: {{l|vi|câu lạc bộ}}
